course.subject: CORE
course.name: Technology and Innovation: Social and Business Perspectives
course.description: This course describes the development of technology and innovation from social and business perspectives.  It covers the technology side of innovations, how an invention can be developed into a successful commercial product, the role of innovation in society and how innovations are created from a socioeconomic perspective.  It highlights that successful development and adoption of innovative products relies not only on the technology itself but also a complex process that is subject to the impact of cultural, political, economic and managerial factors.
course.prerequisites: a passing letter grade in CORE 1401 OR CORE 1402 OR CORE 1403 OR CORE 1404 OR LANG 1002 (prior to 2022-23)

reviews.author: Larry128
reviews.title: Extensive but easy
reviews.comment_content:
The content is very extensive and there are 8 lectures in total:
1. Introduction
2. Economic Implications of
Technology and Innovation
3. Innovation and Strategy
4.1. The Product Innovation Process
4.2. Technology Life Cycles and S Curves
——————(midterm exam)——————
5.1. Open Innovation
5.2. Open Innovation at Huawei
6. Intellectual Property Management
7. User Innovation – Democracy of Innovation
8.1. Diffusion of Innovation
8.2. Case Study: The Adoption of SMS in Hong Kong and China
——————(final exam)——————
In fact, most of the content is kinda common sense. However, if u aim for good grade, u may need to pay more effort on making the cheat sheet for exams
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Xu Yan is good at teaching and always gives good examples (such as personal experience).
reviews.comment_grading:
I think the grading is competitive as the content is pretty easy.
The scores (and my scores):
Midterm- lowest 54, mean 76.1, highest 89 (my score 88.5)
Final- lowest 56, mean 79.5, highest 96 (my score 95)
Group Project- lowest 95, mean 96.5, highest 98 (our group 97)

My final grade is A+
Well, I think I’m pretty lucky that this semester the project we don’t need to present due to the typhoon.
reviews.comment_workload:
For the workload, Prof. Xu Yan didn’t take any attendance and provided us lecture recordings to watch. Technically, you don’t need to attend any lectures.

I think the workload mainly comes from the project- writing an essay.
